instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the batteryâ€™s power rail connects to the motherboard. .
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7050: What is R7050? Current sense shunt resistor for the battery, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 17/18 on ISL6259 should give you 2.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't charge
threads.message:
This board was damaged by wine.
Everything works great except that it won't charge battery and it won't start with battery disconnected.
I have green light, no orange light.
With magsafe connected voltage is changing between 4.2 and 4.6 at fuse F7040

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't charge
threads.message:
Voltage of <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with battery plugged in?

See if <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> are within spec

Already tried a known good battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't charge
threads.message: It works perfect with battery. MagSafe does nothing except light green

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't charge
threads.message:
Alright so that would mean <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR> is alright.
I don't think it confirms <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> being alright though, could you check those? (Resistance on them)

System is able to show battery percentage, right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't charge
threads.message: The usual corroded resistors and or traces to from <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22/51/52.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't charge
threads.message: resistors measures correct when I check between pin 17,18 and 27,28 at <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>. No liquid in that area

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't charge
threads.message:
Where was the corrosion? Voltage on <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>, only with AC.

"correct" is not a value, so measure and specify exact readings.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't charge
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> = 16.5 volt with only AC
There are traces of spill on multiple places but nothing is really corroded. Top half of the board look worse than the other half.

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pin 27,28 is 20,6 ohm
pin 17,18 is 3.5 ohm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't charge
threads.message: Voltage on DCIN pin of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>? If ok then probably a dead ISL.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't charge
threads.message: For some reason I don't have a green light anymore

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't charge
threads.message: Did you check one wire circuite? Do you have 3V42?
